info.title: Bayou Energy API Reference
info.description:
# Introduction
This is the documentation page for Bayou Energy's Utility Data API. This API allows you to manage your connected utility accounts and retrieve utility data for those accounts. Learn more about Bayou Energy at [www.bayou.energy](https://bayou.energy).

# Authentication
We use API keys to authenticate requests. You can find your API keys in the [Bayou Dashboard](https://staging.bayou.energy/dashboard).
Authentication is provided through HTTP Basic Authentication. Use your API key as the username value in the Basic Authentication scheme. The password value does not need to be filled.

# Utility support
The list of supported utilities with support details for each specific utility, as well as their API codes, can be found on our [Utility Support documentation page](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support).

In the `staging` environment, in addition to those utilities, you can also use Speculoos Power (code: `speculoos_power`), which is a fictional utility, to be used for testing purposes only.

# External IDs
To avoid the need to add a new field in your database as part of your Bayou implementation, all API models come with an `external_id` field that can be used to save your identifier.
The `external_id` can be used to retrieve, update or delete any object and can be a string of any format.

If the object is created in your environment, just pass this identifier as an argument when you create it using Bayou's API. Objects created within Bayou's environment can be updated using the Bayou identifier to attach your `external_id` to them.

The use of external IDs is totally optional.

post.description: Uploads a new bill to parse it

customer_id.description: Can be either Bayou's numeric ID for the bill's customer or your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) preceded with `external_id:`. This field is optional.

file.description: The PDF file of the bill to parse

external_id.description: Your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) for this bill (this field must be unique)

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: No file was provided in your request to post a bill.

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The customer_id you provided in the request does not exist.

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The external_id you provided in the request isn’t unique and belongs to <insert other record it belongs to>.

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The file you provided is not in a format we support. PDF’s are the only format supported right now.

external_id.description: Your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) for this customer (this field must be unique)

utility.description: This customer's utility. See [Utility support](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support) for more information

external_id.description: Your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) for this customer (this field must be unique)

utility.description: This customer's utility. See [Utility support](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support) for more information

onboarding_link.description: The URL at which customers can update their billing and utility account data

onboarding_token.description: The token to use when embedding the onboarding component in your website, using the Bayou JS library

has_accepted_terms_on.description: The date and time at which this customer accepted Bayou's terms and conditions

has_filled_credentials.description: Whether or not the customer has filled credentials using their onboarding link

bills_are_ready.description: Whether or not the initial fetching of bills for this customer has completed

utility_has_intervals.description: Whether or not this customer's utility supports interval data

account_has_intervals.description: Whether or not this customer's has existing interval data

intervals_are_ready.description: Whether or not the initial fetching of intervals for this customer has completed

first_interval_discovered.description: The start time of the first interval discovered for this customer

last_interval_discovered.description: The start time of the last interval discovered for this customer

id.description: The utility identifier for this account number

period_from.description: The start of the period this tariff was used for this meter

period_to.description: The end of the period this tariff was used for this meter

line_1.description: The full street address for this meter

line_2.description: The second line of the street address for this meter

postal_code.description: The zip code for this meter

postal_code_suffix.description: The zip code suffix for this meter

gas_choice_id.description: The gas choice id for a meter, if provided

items.description: The tags for this account number

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The request you provided has the email field improperly formatted. An email must be a string, include an “@” and “.” symbol, and be no more than 320 characters
The request you provided has the first_name field improperly formatted. The first_name field must be a string and no more than 30 characters
The request you provided has the last_name field improperly formatted. The last_name field must be a string and no more than 30 characters
The request you provided has the phone_number field improperly formatted. The phone_number field must be a string and no more than 30 characters

The request you provided has the state field improperly formatted. The state field must be a two letter abbreviation in a string format or null. The state codes can be found here https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/post_customers
The request you provided has the zipcode field improperly formatted. The zipcode field must be a string and no more than 30 characters

The utility code you provided in the request is invalid. Did you mean <alternate_valid_utility_code>? A full list of utility codes can be found here https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The external_id you provided in the request isn’t unique and belongs to <insert other record it belongs to>.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Can be either Bayou's numeric ID or your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) for this bill's customer preceded with `external_id:`

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: Only return bills with matching account number

parameters.name: meter_id
parameters.description: Only return bills with matching meter ID

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Only return bills that are issued on or after this date

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Only return bills that are issued on or before this date

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of bills returned

external_id.description: Your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) for this bill (this field must be unique)

status.description: The current status for this bill

customer_id.description: The ID of the customer for which this bill was issued

customer_external_id.description: Your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) for the customer for which this bill was issued

billed_on.description: The date this bill was issued by the utility

utility.description: The utility company that issued this bill. See [Utility support](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support) for more information

account_number.description: The utility account number as displayed on the bill

outstanding_balance.description: Remaining balance from the previous billing cycle

billing_period_from.description: The beginning of the billing period this bill covers

billing_period_to.description: The end of the billing period this bill covers

electricity_consumption.description: Quantity of electricity used this billing cycle, in watt-hours

electricity_amount.description: The amount for all electricity-related charges on the bill, in cents

delivery_charge.description: Bill electricity delivery charge amount, in cents

supply_charge.description: Bill electricity supply charge amount, in cents

community_solar_bill_credit.description: The community solar credit for this bill, in cents

gas_consumption_unit.description: Unit used for describing all quantities of gas for this bill and its meters, can be therms or ccf

gas_consumption.description: Quantity of gas used this billing cycle, in therms

gas_amount.description: The amount for all gas-related charges on the bill, in cents

total_amount.description: The total amount for the bill, including gas, in cents

status.description: The current status for this meter

billing_period_from.description: The start of the billing period for this meter

billing_period_to.description: The end of the billing period for this meter

consumption.description: The consumption of this meter, in watt-hours or therms

line_1.description: The full street address for this meter

line_2.description: The second line of the street address for this meter

postal_code.description: The zip code for this meter

postal_code_suffix.description: The zip code suffix for this meter

tariff.description: The tariff name for this meter

gas_choice_id.description: The gas choice id for a meter, if provided

file_url.description: The URL at which the PDF for this bill can be fetched (valid for 15 minutes)

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The end date chronologically comes before the start date in your request.
The end date is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01.
The request you provided has the limit field improperly formatted. The limit must be an integer formatted as a string (ie 1, 2, 12, 24)
The start date is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01.

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

The customer_id you provided in the request does not exist.
The external_id you provided in the request does not exist.

get.description: Retrieves the list of intervals for that customer

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Can be either Bayou's numeric ID or your own [identifier](https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/external-ids) for these intervals customer preceded with `external_id:`

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Only return intervals that are created after this value

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Only return intervals that are created before this value

parameters.name: meter_id
parameters.description: Only return intervals whose meter match with this ID

200.description: Returns the intervals for that customer

first_interval_discovered.description: The start time of the first interval discovered for this customer

last_interval_discovered.description: The start time of the last interval discovered for this customer

granularities.description: Granularities of the intervals in this response, in minutes
Granularities of the intervals in this meter, in minutes

start.description: The start time of this interval

end.description: The end time of this interval

electricity_consumption.description: Consumed electricity for this interval, in Wh

net_electricity_consumption.description: Net electricity usage for this interval, in Wh

generated_electricity.description: Generated electricity for this interval, in Wh

electricity_demand.description: Maximum demand for this interval, in W

gas_consumption.description: Consumed gas for this interval, in therms

created_at.description: The time this interval was created

updated_at.description: The time this interval was last updated

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The start timestamp is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01T00:00:00Z.
The end timestamp is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01T00:00:00Z.
The end timestamp chronologically comes before the start timestamp in your request.
This customer’s utility doesn’t have interval data. View utility support here https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

granularities.description: Granularities of the intervals in this response, in minutes
Granularities of the intervals in this meter, in minutes

start.description: The start time of this interval

end.description: The end time of this interval

electricity_consumption.description: Consumed electricity for this interval, in Wh

net_electricity_consumption.description: Net electricity usage for this interval, in Wh

generated_electricity.description: Generated electricity for this interval, in Wh

electricity_demand.description: Maximum demand for this interval, in W

gas_consumption.description: Consumed gas for this interval, in therms

created_at.description: The time this interval was created

updated_at.description: The time this interval was last updated

docs_url.description: A link to documentation providing more details about the error

value.error_message: The account_number you provided in the request either does not exist for this customer or has no bills. This customer has the following account_numbers with bills <account_numbers>
The bill_id you provided in the request does not exist.
The bill_id you provided in the request is not a valid integer.
The meter_id you provided in the request either does not exist for this customer or has no bills. This customer has the following meters with bills <meter_ids>
The request you provided has the address_line_1 field improperly formatted. The address_line_1 field must be a string and no more than 30 characters.
The request you provided has the address_line_2 field improperly formatted. The address_line_2 field must be a string and no more than 30 characters.
The request you provided has the city field improperly formatted. The city field must be a string and no more than 30 characters.
The request you provided has the email field improperly formatted. An email must be a string, include an “@” and “.” symbol, and be no more than 320 characters
The request you provided has the first_name field improperly formatted. The first_name field must be a string and no more than 30 characters
The customer_id you provided in the request does not exist.
The customer_id you provided in the request is not a valid integer.
The request you provided has the last_name field improperly formatted. The last_name field must be a string and no more than 30 characters
The request you provided has the phone_number field improperly formatted. The phone_number field must be a string and no more than 30 characters

The request you provided has the state field improperly formatted. The state field must be a two letter abbreviation in a string format or null. The state codes can be found here https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/post_customers
The request you provided has the zipcode field improperly formatted. The zipcode field must be a string and no more than 30 characters
The end date chronologically comes before the start date in your request.
The end date is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01.
The end timestamp is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01T00:00:00Z.
The external_id you provided in the request does not exist.
The external_id you provided in the request is not a valid string.
The external_id you provided in the request isn’t unique and belongs to <insert other record it belongs to>.
The meter_id you provided in the request either does not exist for this customer or has no intervals. This customer has the following meters with interval data <meter_ids>
The request you provided has the limit field improperly formatted. The limit must be an integer formatted as a string (ie 1, 2, 12, 24)
The method <request_method> is not allowed for this endpoint. The allowed methods are <allowed_methods>
No file was provided in your request to post a bill.
The requested route cannot be found. Refer to Bayou’s documentation for available API requests.
The start date is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01.
The start timestamp is in an invalid format. An example of a valid format is 2022-11-01T00:00:00Z.
The end timestamp chronologically comes before the start timestamp in your request.
The file you provided is not in a format we support. PDF’s are the only format supported right now.

The utility code you provided in the request is invalid. Did you mean <alternate_valid_utility_code>? A full list of utility codes can be found here https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support
This customer’s utility doesn’t have interval data. View utility support here https://docs.bayou.energy/reference/utility-support

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: The following section defines requests that allow you to manage your customer accounts.

tags.name: Bills
tags.description: The following section defines requests that allow you to manage the utility bills of your customer accounts.

tags.name: Intervals
tags.description: The following section defines requests that allow you to access intervals data from your customer accounts.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: The following section defines the callbacks that we send to your servers. The webhook URL and settings can be configured in the [Bayou Dashboard](https://staging.bayou.energy/dashboard).
